page.title: 11HEALTH
page.content: Begun in 1965 and opened in 1977 {Barnsley General Hospital}treats people in the 127 square mile Barnsley Metropolitan area. The tallest block is 115 feet high and has 9 floors. It is built of re-inforced concrete. It has 3 main entrances: visitor, casualty and outpatient. The Hospital, which costs Â£18,000,000 a year to run, has 775 beds, 6 being private, and 38 wards. It employs 80 doctors, 30 consultants, 551 nurses and 100 midwives. There are 191 cleaners and 29 cooks in every day. In a year 25,000 people come to the Hospital for treatment as well as 150,000 outpatients. 65,000 accidents are treated and 11,500 operations are carried out a year. There are 2500 babies born each year and the number of deaths is about the same.
